title: ‘A jumble of tendons, bones and muscles’: Mine injuries haunt doctors in Ukraine
description: Amid Ukraine's ongoing counteroffensive to retake land from Russian forces, doctors are grappling with a demoralizing surge in mine blast injuries.

title: New details about Australian mushroom deaths stir speculation
description: Three guests at a luncheon in Australia have died of suspected mushroom poisoning, and a fourth is in critical condition. Authorities say the victims may have eaten the toxic death cap mushroom.

title: Russian central bank hikes interest rates to 12 percent after ruble’s decline
description: The bank’s emergency action followed a sharp decline in the value of the national currency and criticism by some in the Kremlin of soft monetary policy.

title: Celebration and anguish as Taliban marks second anniversary of takeover
description: In a statement, U.N. human rights experts said that two years into Taliban rule, it is clear that “the concept of a ‘reformed’ Taliban has been exposed as mistaken.”

title: German minister cancels Pacific trip after yet another plane malfunction
description: The canceled visit is just the latest in a string of official trips to be affected by problems with government planes.

title: U.K. arrests three Bulgarians on Russian spying charges, reports BBC
description: The BBC reported the men were working for Russian security services, while London police have only confirmed the arrest.

title: Huge fire at gas station in Russia’s Dagestan kills 35, injures dozens
description: Dozens of people were killed and more injured in the southern Russian region of Dagestan when a fire spread from a car repair shop to a nearby gas station.

title: China’s solution to bad economic news? No news.
description: The youth unemployment rate has risen every month this year, a sign of China's increasing economic troubles. Authorities have now decided to simply stop releasing it.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Explosions in Ukraine’s west; ruble tumbles to 17-month low
description: Overnight strikes in the Ukrainian cities of Lviv and Lutsk hit residential and industrial buildings, respectively.

title: This region fueled India’s population boom. Now it’s in danger.
description: The fertile soil of the Indo-Gangetic Plain sustained civilizations and agricultural booms for centuries. But climate change and pollution from over-industrialization is disrupting the region's unique weather patterns and putting its approximately 400 million residents at risk.

title: The Smithsonian’s ‘Bone Doctor’ scavenged thousands of body parts
description: Ales Hrdlicka was the head curator of physical anthropology for the Smithsonian. Aided by a global network, he collected human brains to support racist beliefs

title: Heed lessons of Libya, Algerian foreign minister says after Niger coup
description: Three weeks after a coup in Niger, the foreign minister of neighboring Algeria warns against the destabilizing potential of sanctions or a foreign intervention.
